channel.title: Minecraft even open up
channel.description:
I had to format my computer and now minecraft won't even open up for me. Sometimes it says nothing at all and other times it says something along the lines of..
[code]The drive or network connection that the shortcut 'minecraft.lnk' refers to is unavaiblable Make sure that the disk is inserted properly or network resource is available and then try again[/code]
I've tried everything I can think of..anyone have an idea?

item.title: Minecraft even open up
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

That’s ridiculous. If worst comes to worst just download the minecraft launcher for Linux and put the command for Linux in a batch file to run it.

Read full topic

item.title: Minecraft even open up
item.dc:creator: @omgilikepie omgilikepie
item.description:
@omgilikepie wrote:

I use the shortcut that’s provided in the .minecraft folder every time…same way I did it before I had to format my computer. =/

Guess I won’t be playing until I can find me a new computer, because I really don’t feel like formatting this one again.

Read full topic

item.title: Minecraft even open up
item.dc:creator: @NotLikingThis NotLikingThis
item.description:
@NotLikingThis wrote:

If you changed the directory of the server and had the .exe file on your desktop(shortcut) then try deleting that shortcut and copy and pasting the one thats linked to that folder.
EDIT: For me I had to keep clicking it for like 5-10 times and then it finally opened.

Read full topic

item.title: Minecraft even open up
item.dc:creator: @hat_trix hat trix
item.description:
@hat_trix wrote:

its not only the shortcut, its the .exe file itself that isnt opening. thats the error he gets when he tries to open the shortcut

Read full topic

item.title: Minecraft even open up
item.dc:creator: @omgilikepie omgilikepie
item.description:
@omgilikepie wrote:

About 10 different minecraft downloads…re-installing java…restarting my computer…

Read full topic

item.title: Minecraft even open up
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

Pretty much self explanatory - the file that the shortcut refers to is missing. What exactly did you try??

Read full topic
